posts.author: darktooth
posts.content:
Many years ago, I had fun using the toolset to form items which would make any character OP. This time, using the Pretty Good Character Creator, I’d like to create items which would guarantee any character 100% impervious to damage and death. I know that it’s boring when used in single player modules, but at times I’d like to see bosses like Halaster get beaten by a lvl 1 bard soloing Infinite Dungeons. So these are what I thought are the essential item properties:
 
Damage Immunity: Acid 100% Immunity Bonus
Damage Immunity: Bludgeoning 100% Immunity Bonus
Damage Immunity: Cold 100% Immunity Bonus
Damage Immunity: Divine 100% Immunity Bonus
Damage Immunity: Electrical 100% Immunity Bonus
Damage Immunity: Fire 100% Immunity Bonus
Damage Immunity: Magical 100% Immunity Bonus
Damage Immunity: Negative Energy 100% Immunity Bonus
Damage Immunity: Piercing 100% Immunity Bonus
Damage Immunity: Positive Energy 100% Immunity Bonus
Damage Immunity: Slashing 100% Immunity Bonus
Damage Immunity: Sonic 100% Immunity Bonus
Immunity: Critical Hits
Immunity: Death Magic
Immunity: Fear
Immunity: Level/ability drain
Immunity: Poison
Spell Immunity: Breath, Petrification
Spell Immunity: Flesh to Stone
Spell Immunity: Gaze, Petrification
Spell Immunity: Implosion
Spell Immunity: Touch, Petrification

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Nice list. God mode in Infinite Dungeons. 

Anyway to be helpful consider adding:
Immunity: Mind-affecting (I believe fear and Mind Affecting are different)
Immunity: Ability/Level Drain
Freedom
Immunity: Critical Hit (for devastating critical opponents who might instantly kill you despite all your protections)

Consider replace Spell Immunity: Implosion with:
Immunity: Level 9 spells or less (I think this property exists)

Consider immunity to poison/disease but Ability/Level Drain should cover that mostly. I believe there might be a poison/disease or two that might have a fortitude save or die.

Regeneration is handy to have just in case you do take damage LOL although your defences look pretty water tight to me.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Oh rust monsters can kill items too. I've had belts and helmets lost that way.

I will need to be enlightened about ruin armor!

posts.author: darktooth
posts.content:
I will add Immunity: Critical Hits as per your suggestion, As for the other properties, adding them might just be redundant, if only for the purpose of avoiding damage and instant death.

Ruin Armor is an item property which could be applied to weapons and projectiles. It could cause an equipped armor or shield to be unequipped or destroyed, depending on the module.

posts.author: darktooth
posts.content:
Imagine…
1. a vanilla character has access to Time Stop and is able to exploit the TS multiplier glitch, which allows any action to be performed a many times as possible; and
2. has Devastating Critical feat
 
I made a list of item properties which, I believe, are the required minimum for such a character to have maximum chance of killing any opponent.
 
On any item:
Ability Bonus: Strength +12
Cast Spell: Blade Barrier
Cast Spell: Epic Spell: Greater Ruin
Cast Spell: Epic Spell: Hellball
 
Strictly on weapon/s:
Damage Bonus: Acid 2d12 Damage
Damage Bonus: Bludgeoning 2d12 Damage
Damage Bonus: Cold 2d12 Damage
Damage Bonus: Divine 2d12 Damage
Damage Bonus: Electrical 2d12 Damage
Damage Bonus: Fire 2d12 Damage
Damage Bonus: Magical 2d12 Damage
Damage Bonus: Negative Energy 2d12 Damage
Damage Bonus: Piercing 2d12 Damage
Damage Bonus: Positive Energy 2d12 Damage
Damage Bonus: Slashing 2d12 Damage
Damage Bonus: Sonic 2d12 Damage
Enhancement Bonus: +20
On Hit Cast Spell: Bombardment Level 40
On Hit Cast Spell: Chain Lightning Level 40
On Hit Cast Spell: Creeping Doom Level 40
On Hit Cast Spell: Crumble Level 40
On Hit Cast Spell: Delayed Blast Fireball Level 40
On Hit Cast Spell: Destruction Level 40
On Hit Cast Spell: Earthquake Level 40
On Hit Cast Spell: Flesh to Stone Level 40
On Hit Cast Spell: Horrid Wilting Level 40
On Hit Cast Spell: Ice Storm Level 40
On Hit Cast Spell: Implosion Level 40
On Hit Cast Spell: Negative Energy Burst Level 40
On Hit Cast Spell: Phantasmal Killer Level 40
On Hit Cast Spell: Quillfire Level 40
On Hit Cast Spell: Wail of the Banshee Level 40
 
If you think I missed anything, feel free to suggest.

Edit: My bad, this is a severely incomplete list. I haven’t taken into account that an enemy might have immunity to any specific spell. In that case, then there is no minimum. All Cast Spell and On Hit Cast Spell effects must be included.

I spent some time thinking of a character that is perfectly suited for these items, to play in an environment that will allow it (equip any custom item, total item cost not to exceed 4.36 million GP for lvl 40 PCs). What I came up is a near-invincible build that could deal damage across 12 damage types, cast all insta-kill spells, inflict devastating critical hits, and strip enemies of armor, shield or weapon, or steal items from their inventory:

Total item cost: 4,360,000 GP
 
Notable weaknesses: 

This build is not immune to disarm and ruin armor: but these are mitigated by assigning non-essential properties on armor, shield and weapon.

It is also vulnerable to creature attacks (e.g. beholder special attacks) for which immunity cannot be provided by items.
 
It is not immune to immobilization caused by spells Bigby 7 and 9.

Regarding offense, it suffers from low AB and low DC of spells, although this wouldn’t be much of an issue if playing in an environment where one is limited by total item cost. While it is not immune to taunt and spells that cause deafness, its shield will nullify all spell failure.

Enemies with SR above 32 (or above 22 with immunity to Mordenkainen's Disjunction) are immune to on hit cast level 2 spells from weapons. Enemies who would otherwise be vulnerable to damage but is regenerating more than 16 HP will negate all damage at the end of each round, from a 1d4 weapon wielded by a character with four attacks per round.
 
Feel free to comment on the build, I’ll appreciate it.
